COST OF LIVING ALLOWANCE TO PEOPLES BANK PENSIONERS 0629/06 2.

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Ineternal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Is he aware that the variable Cost of Living Allowance paid to the pensioners who retired from the Peoples Bank has been suspended? (b) Will he state, (i) the reason for taking this decision, which causes a serious impact on these pensioners economically; and (ii) whose decision it was? (c) Will he admit that the Banks management has shown an amount of approximately 230 million rupees which should have been paid to pensioners over a period of 10 years as part of the profits they have earned? (d) As this allowance is paid to both pensioners and their widowers by the Bank of Ceylon and other state banks without any difference, will he act to pay this allowance to the Peoples Bank pensioners as well? (e) If not why?
( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) , . . ? ? ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) .
. . . . . III PEOPLES BANK OFFICERS ASSOCIATION , - 02. PEOPLES BANK - HEAD OFFICE - COLOMBO 02.

Chairmans Office Peoples Bank November 22, 2006 Revision of payment of Peoples Bank pension Scheme - B.P. No. 411/96 The Board approved the proposal to revise the existing Pension Scheme of the Peoples Bank and adopt the following scheme with effectfrom the date of approval of the Board paper. (1) Bank employee who has completed 10 years of pensionable service but less than 30 years will be eligible to receive monthly pension on the basis of 90% of his salary at retirement as follows : (a) Commuted pension and (b) The reduced monthly pension (i. e. 80% of the last drawn salary) from the date of retirement at the age of 55 years. He will be entitled to the restoration of the unreduced monthly pension (90% of salary) on completion of 120 months from the date of commencement of the reduced monthly pension. (2) A Bank employee who has completed 30 years of sevice and over will be eligible to receive a Pension calculated on the basis of 90% of his salary at retirement as follows : (a) Commuted pension (b) The un-reduced monthly pension (90% of salary at retirement) notwithstanding the fact that he has drawn a commuted pension on retirement. I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true extract of the Minutes of the Meeting of the Board of Directors of the Peoples Bank held on 07th June 1996 at its Head Office in Colombo. Secretary to the Board
. ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) . . . . . ( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) . . ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) () .
, CASUAL EMPLOYEES OF LANKA MINERAL SANDS COMPANY, PULMODDAI 0715/06 03.

asked the Minister of Industrial Development : (a) Is he aware that the casual employees recruited for service in the Lanka Mineral Sands Company, Pulmoddai during the period from 1984 to 2004, have not been confirmed so far ? (b) Will he inform this House for what reason the 30 employees who have served in the casual service for over a year and are now in excess, have not been confirmed in this manner ? (c) Will he state, , (i) whether he will take action to confirm these employees? (ii) if so, from which date ? (d) If not, why ?

TOTAL FOREIGN INVESTMENT DURING LAST TWENTY YEARS 0813/06 4.

asked the Minister of Enterprise Development and Investment Promotion : (a) Will he state on per year basis for the last twenty years, (i) the total foreign investment in the country ; (ii) the total foreign investments that have been invested in capital market; (iii) the foreign savings component in the country; and, (iv) aforesaid values as a percentage of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of that year? (b) If not, why ?

, LAND DISTRIBUTED UNDER MURIYAKULAMA LIFT IRRIGATION SCHEME 0997/07 10.

() ? () , ? , : () (i) 99/160 120 30.656 , (ii) 10 , ? () 25 , 35 60 ? () , ? () , ? () ? () , ? asked the Minister of Lands and Land Development : (a) Is he aware that, (i) under the Muriyakulama Lift Irrigation Scheme in the Anamaduwa Divisional Secretarys Division, 30.656 hectares of land was distributed among 130 allottees by plan No. 99/160; and, (ii) agro wells have been constructed by the Samurdhi Authority at a cost of around one million rupees for providing water to the allotees for cultivation? (b) Will he accept that a total of 60 acres have been allotted to two individualas as 25 acres for one person for a coconut husk industry and 35 acres to the other for another project, from the said land distributed under the Lift Irrigation Scheme mentioned above? (c) If these lands have been so allotted to these for projects approved by the Board of Investment< will he state what those projects are?

(d) If these lands have been so allotted to these persons in an illegal manner, will he state whether he will take steps to reacquire the said lands and take legal action against the persons who allotted such lands? (e) Will he take steps to provide alternative lands to the allottees that had been living on the lands so acquired? (f) If not, why? ( )

, RESPONSIBILITIES OF MINISTER OF URBAN DEVELOPMENT AND SACRED AREA DEVELOPMENT AND NON-CABINET MINISTER OF URBAN DEVELOPMENT 1082/07 7. . . . ( )
) (The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana on behalf of The Hon. Sunil Handunnetti) - (I) : () ? () ? () ? () / .-- (i) ; (ii) ( / ) ; (iii) , , ; ? () , ?

Asked the Minister of Urban Development and Sacred Area Development : (a) Will he inform this House separately, the responsibilities of the Minister of Urban Development and Sacred Area Development and the non-Cabinet Minister of Urban Development? (b) Will he state in this House separately, the institutions that come under the purview of the said Ministers? (c) Will he state as to how the responsibilities of the above Cabinet Minister and those of the non-Cabinet Minister differ from each other? (d) Will he submit information to this House on the value of, -- (i) the Monthly salaries and allowances ; (ii) telephone bills (official/mobile and residential) ; and, (iii) salaries of the staff, fuel allowances and telephone bills, which the above Cabinet/non-Cabinet Minis ter is entitled to? (e) If not why ?
NON - CABINET MINISTERIAL PORTFOLIOS OF NATION BUILDING 1083/07 8. . . . ( )
) (The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Sunil Handunnetti) , , , - (I) : () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () (i) ; (ii) ; ? () (i) 05 ; (ii) ; ? () , ?

Asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Admini-stration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Securiy, Law and Order, -: (a) Will he inform this House, - (i) the number of non- Cabinet ministerial portfolios of Nation Building; (ii) separately, the responsibilities of those Minis-ters ; (iii) the institutions that are allocated to those minis-terial portfolios ? (b) Will he inform this House whether, - (i) there are separate offices and staff for those min-isters; (ii) these Ministers are granted provisions and facili-ties which are accorded to all other Non-cabinet Ministers? (c) Will he state , - (i) as to how the responsibility of the Cabinet is represented in respect of the 05 ministerial posts, in this manner ; (ii) the basis on which the above ministerial portfo-lios are allocated ? (d) If not why ?

SUPPLY OF WATER FACILITIES TO PEO-PLE OF NORTH WESTERN PROVINCE THROUGH THE PROPOSED MORAGAHAKANDA AND DE-DURU OYA WATER SUPPLY SCHEMES ( ) (The Hon. Gamini Jayawickrama Perera) , : " . . , . ." , . , , . , . . . . . . . . . . - - . . , . . . . ; , ; , , . , . ? . master plan . , . . . CECB feasibility report . ? ,

, , . , . , . . 600 . CECB feasibility report . * . , . . , , . , Proposed Conveyances to NWP Area The proposed conveyance route will be based on the recommended final project configuration of the Moragahakanda project by the con-sultant Lahmeyer International. At present consultant has given two configurations for Mora-gahakanda project as mentioned below pending a final commitment. Configuration 1 A dam on the Ambanganga at Moragahakanda, with full supply level (FSL) 185 m asl,capacity 520 MCM and a power plant with installed capacity 20 MW incorporated in the dam;" - 20 . - "A Second Bowatenna - Lenadora Tunnel with 25 m3 / sec capac-ity, and upgrading and extension of the Huruluwewa Feeder Canal;" . . "Recommendations" ; Upper Mi Oya and Hakwatuna Oya Development Project is technically feasible and economically viable with power options under route A1. It is recommended to be undertaken for implementation to alleviate the continued and long felt shortage of water in the Upper Mi Oya basin and Hakwatuna Oya basin areas." Also it is strongly recommended that the project be implemented as an economic infrastructure project that will lead to dramatic in-crease in employment, output and income generation. It will alleviate the poverty of about 16,700 farmer families. , 16700 , - in this remote agricultural population suffering from chronic irrigation water deficiencies. Process for arranging the finances and the preparation of ten-der... . , . . . , ,
[ .] ] [Expunged on the order of the Chair.] . .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Thank you, Hon. Kanagasabai. Can you conclude your speech, please?

( . ) (The Hon. T. Kanagasabai) Sir, I want to say a few words in English because the Hon. Minister is here. We have vacancies for 80 mainte-nance labourers. Your directors and other people say that they have got some sub-circulars. We are not concerned about circulars, Hon. Minister. What we want is, to fill these vacancies. Money is allocated. There are vacancies. You are not giving money to employ these casual people for 30 days a month. You give work only for five or ten days and finally you say that they have not completed 150 days. What is this? I do not know what words I can use? Kindly see that these 80 people are appointed very early, otherwise all our canals and drains will get further damaged. These are already damaged. Thank you.
